Now, comparing this P/E ratio of 15 with the industry average of 18 tells us something about the valuation of the stock. A P/E ratio that is less than the industry average might indicate that the stock is undervalued because investors are willing to pay less for each dollar of earnings. Conversely, a P/E ratio that is greater than the industry average could imply that the stock is overvalued since investors are paying more for each dollar of earnings. In this case, the company's P/E ratio is significantly lower than the industry average, which suggests that it is currently undervalued.
